_header: That may we see by Saint Bede
_description: St. Bede and the Birds: Narratio in the Northern Homily Cycle

BodSelSup52.First Lines:
ffrendes we may see be sant bedeþat mekyll vsyd all gud
                    dede…
BodSelSup52.Last Lines:
…þat we þen with hym lendVnto þat blys þat
                    hathys non end

BodAsh42.First Lines:
þat mai we se be saynte Bedeþat mikil wroȝt goddes
                    dede…
BodAsh42.Last Lines:
…And þat we may wiþ him wendeInto þe ioye
                    wiþ outen ende . Amen .

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
ÞAt may we seo beo seint BedeÞat muche ferde wiþ
                    such good dede…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And þat we may þenne wiþ him wendeIn to his
                    blisse wiþ outen ende. AMEN.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.
BodEngPoeta1.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Die Evangelien-Geschichten der Homiliensammlung des Ms. Vernon.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         57 (1877): 241-316: 274.

CULDd11.First Lines:
Þat may we seen be seynt Bedeþat euere was besi in good
                    dedeFor wreten in his lyf we fyndeþat he was in his elde al
                    blynde…
CULDd11.Last Lines:
…And þat we may þan wiþ him wendevn to his
                    blisse wiþ outen ende
CULDd11.Note:
Division between 3288 and the preceding 4670 occurs 2 lines later in this MS, for begins
                    ‘For wreten…’.

CULAdd8335.First Lines:
ffor of Seynt Bede writen we fyhndeÞat in his elde was al
                    blynde…
CULAdd8335.Last Lines:
…And þat we may þen with him wendeVnto þat
                    blisse þat neuer sale ende
CULAdd8335.Attributed Title:
narracio de sancto Beda qualiter predicabat lapidibus (margin, p.
                    139)

BLAdd38010.First Lines:
And þat may yhe se be sainte bedeThat mykill farde with skyll
                    gud dede…
BLAdd38010.Last Lines:
…And þat we may with hym wendeVnto blys with outen
                    ende

BLHar2391.First Lines: For wretyn in hys lyf we fyndþat he was in hys eyld blynd…
BLHar2391.Last Lines: …þise er þe wordis of owr gospellas men with ynglych tong may telle
BLHar2391.Attributed Title: Dominica tercia in quadragesima (left margin, f. 178), with “A tale” written above this

MinULZ822.First Lines:
And þat may ȝe se be saynte bedeþat mykelde farde
                    with swelke gude dedis…
MinULZ822.Last Lines:
…& at we may þan with hym wendevnto þe blysse
                    with outene ende

HunHM129.First Lines:
And þat may se be seint bedeþat moche ferd with soche
                    dede…
HunHM129.Last Lines:
…And þat we may with hym wendIn to þat blis with
                    outyn end
HunHM129.Note:
Listed in Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.
         New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press,
            1943 as appearing on f. 80; written as if
                    continuation of 4670, with no
                    indication of new text at its first line.
